again at any minute if I am unlucky I
may in addition be sent to war where I
shall be forced to kill men of foreign
nations who have done me no harm where I
may be maimed or killed or sent to
certain destructions in the case of the
garrison ancestor Pole and other cases
in every war or what be most terrible
wall
maybe sent against my own compatriots
and have to kill my own brothers for
some dynastic or some state interest
which have absolutely nothing to do with
me so much for the comparative
disadvantages the comparative advantage
of compliance and non-compliance are as
follows for the man who submits the
advantage will be that after exposing
himself to all the humiliation and
performing all the barbarities required
of him he may if he escapes being killed
get a decoration of red or gold tinsel
to stick on his clown's dress he may if
he is very lucky be put in command of
hundreds of thousands of others as
brutalized as himself be called a field
marshal and get a lot of money the
advantages of the man who refuses to
obey will consistent for serving his
dignity as a man gaining the approach of
good men and above all knowing that he
is doing the work of God and so
undoubtedly good good to his fellow man
so much for the advantages and
disadvantages of both lines of conduct
for a man of the wealthy class and
oppressor for a man of the poor working
class the advantages and disadvantages
will be the same but with a great
increase of disadvantage the
disadvantage for the poor man who
submits will be aggravated by the fact
that he will be taken part in it and as
it were ascending to its strength in the
state of subjection in which he held
himself but no consideration as to how
far the state is useful or beneficial to
the man who helped to support it by
serving the army nor the advantage or
disadvantage for the individual of
compliance or non-compliance which state
demands will decide the question the
continued existence or the abolition of
government this question will be finally
decided beyond appealed by the religious
consciousness or conscience of every man
who is forced whether he will or no
through Universal conscription to face
the question whether the state is to
continue to exist or not end of chapter
